definitions.definition: the basic and most important part of something:
examples: The lack of government funding is at the core of the problem.
They are cutting back production of some of their core products.

definitions.definition: a value, belief, etc. that is basic and more important than any other:
examples: The final status negotiations would focus on the core issues of the peace process.

definitions.definition: the most important or largest part of a company's business activities:
examples: The company's core operations include entertainment and aviation.

definitions.definition: the most important parts of a course of study, that all students must learn
found in the main part of the body, but not the arms or the legs:
examples: Pilates is good for strengthening the core muscles.

definitions.definition: to remove the core from a piece of fruit:
examples: Peel and core the pears before cooking them.
